title: BatchNorm doesn't support DoubleTensor
body_html:
Hey, Any specific reason why BatchNorm module excludes DoubleTensor's from its operations ?

FloatTensor works fine with BatchNorm while DoubleTensor yields a cast error (similarly for cuda.DoubleTensor too)

import torch import torch.nn as nn m = nn.BatchNorm2d(3) input_var = torch.autograd.Variable(torch.DoubleTensor(2,3,5,5)) o = m(input_var)

Traceback (most recent call last): File "test.py", line 6, in <module> o = m(input_var) File "/home/praveer/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 206, in __call__ result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs) File "/home/praveer/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/batchnorm.py", line 43, in forward self.training, self.momentum, self.eps) File "/home/praveer/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/nn/functional.py", line 439, in batch_norm return f(input, weight, bias) RuntimeError: std::bad_cast

FloatTensor works fine with BatchNorm while DoubleTensor yields a cast error (similarly for cuda.DoubleTensor too)

`import torch
import torch.nn as nn
m = nn.BatchNorm2d(3)

o  = m(input_var)
